main event: A rounded object resembling a meteor was observed at high altitude, moving at a high rate of speed, suddenly slowing down and speeding up again. It was reported to be a missile on a special flight.
interesting points: The object appeared to be a flight test missile.
It was observed by a person in the rear seat and was reported to be traveling at a high rate of speed and high altitude.
The object was observed heading toward the sun and then straight before fading out after 3 seconds.
The report suggests that the operations officer at the flight service may have mistaken the object for a prior released balloon.
This sighting took place on November 7, 1958, at CAF VIS, 350 miles west of California.
location: CAF VIS, 350 miles west of California
witnesses: person in the rear seat, operations officer at the flight service
